New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and led the Oklahoma City Thunder to a franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season win.
Key Match Events: The Thunder trailed by 16 in the first half before pulling within 52-48 at halftime.
Shaking off a cold shooting first half, the Thunder exploded for 42 third-quarter points and an 18-point lead heading into the fourth quarter.
Williams hit a runner at the halftime buzzer to cut the Clippers lead to four, then scored the first six points of the second half to jumpstart a 23-5 run that put the Thunder in control.
Post-Match Reflections: Gilgeous-Alexander expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Amir Coffey led the Clippers with 26 points.
Norman Powell missed his first nine shots and finished with six points on 1-of-11 shooting including 0-for-5 from three-point range.
